title: Riot Banned Me For No Reason
body:
Not. I didn't get banned because I didn't;

* Cheat
* Flame
* Troll
* Leave

It was *really* hard, but I managed to not get banned by avoiding those four things.

All of these ruin the game for others. Before you do them, think about how it affects
others and how you feel when it happens to you.

If you think your ban or restriction was unwarranted, submit a [Support Ticket](https://support.riotgames.com/hc/en-us/requests/new).
The forum community can sympathize with you (or not), but only Player Support can rescind it.

I think you're severely misunderstanding how bad RIOT's ban system is currently.

My games consist of "gg", "ty", "have a nice day" and yet I consistently get reported if our team loses.  I currently have a 75 game restriction... why? I don't know. I put in a support ticket asking exactly this and all RIOT can tell me is that I "harassing your teammates to gank for you, complaining in chat, blaming your team for not following your call"

I truly don't know where this comes into play.  If I ask my jg to gank and ping a few times cause I'm getting pushed under tower is that "harassing"? If I complain that Riot really needs to understand that basic math is that 3>2 and the game should have ended does that make me toxic when we're down 20+ kills?  Does saying "hey you guys probably shouldn't have walked down mid 1 at a time into a 1v5" means I'm blaming them and why would that be a bad thing if they ARE to blame?

It's not so simple. There are outliers to any statistical system and inappropriate measures take throughout ANY justice system.  At current there is NO rulelist, NO list of banned phrases, NO ability to appeal (because RIOT support specifically says they do not remove ANY chat restriction or ban) and no form for the community (because we've been under maintenance for months) to contribute to the selection process.

Sorry, but people like you need to get off their high horse and realize that free speech and communication on every level shouldn't be censored.  I agree that there should be a penalty when people are horrible (and yes there's a great many people out there doing it) but to suggest that people aren't being banned improperly is just ignorant.

I've asked RIOT support to provide specific details as I cannot, and I'm certain they cannot come up with a good example, find anything in my chat logs that warrant 75 games restricted.

Hi, lately I've been encountering an uptick of trolls coinciding with the end of the school year for many. It isn't a matter of if you encounter a troll, but when. Here's how I approach this:

1. I do not swear or get upset. You'll find yourself getting banned.
2. Upon the beginning of the match, I follow all formalities greeting opponents. Then I go to my position.
3. I ask politely for the person to find their position. I'll repeat, but I won't get upset. If the player leaves, I thank them and it is the end. We have fun.
4. If they persist and try to get you to engage in an argument during the match, I tell the player that I will not argue and end the conversation. Normal chat with teammates, including the troll ensures. Gj, etc. I do not mute, as I'd like read what is being said. 
5. There is a chance that you've been trolled enough and you're at a deficit in the match. Thus, the troll attempts to engage you with disparaging remarks. Do not engage. Let the troll speak. The more said, the better the ammunition for a good ban.
6. Upon the end of the match, gg, etc. Maybe I'll throw in "report troll" but always gg. This is being cordial regardless of the outcome.
7. Report. Best thing about trolls is that they're bored and they try to antagonize. Don't feed into it. They'll talk and talk, but see it as evidence for the report. By the end of the match if a lot of bashing has been done, it will make a ban definitely likely. It is very easy. In the report when filing the ticket, I always write "read the chat text." If your teammates support you, they'll say something like "ban troll" in the text. Point is, the evidence is there.

Good luck. Happy Gaming.
